intro: Teucrium multicaule subsp. multicaule, commonly known as blueweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and rocky areas. Its aromatic leaves and flowers make it a valuable plant for both ecological and ornamental purposes.
